com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Class PaintTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.PaintTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBoundsTool, AbstractLineTool, AbstractPathTool, AbstractPolylineTool, AbstractSelectionTool, ArrowTool, FillTool, MagnifierTool, TextTool

    public abstract class PaintTool
extends Object
implements SurfaceInteractionObserver, CanvasCommitObserver
    A base tool class holding common attribute providers (like stroke, fill and font), plus empty, template methods for keyboard and mouse events.

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        public void activate(PaintCanvas canvas)
        Activates the tool on a given canvas. A paint tool does not "paint" on the canvas until it is activated. Typically, only one tool is active on a canvas at any given time, but there is no technical limitation preventing multiple tools from being active at once. Use deactivate() to stop this tool from painting on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The paint canvas on which to activate the tool.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates the tool on the canvas. A deactivated tool no longer affects the canvas and all listeners / observers are un-subscribed making the tool available for garbage collection.

      • onCommit

        public void onCommit(PaintCanvas canvas,
                     ChangeSet changeSet,
                     BufferedImage canvasImage)
        Fires when an new shape or image is committed from scratch onto the canvas.
        Specified by:
        onCommit in interface CanvasCommitObserver
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which the commit is occurring.
        changeSet - The set of changes being committed.
        canvasImage - The resulting canvas image (including the committed change)

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e,
                       Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when the mouse cursor has been moved onto a component but no buttons have been pushed.
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Parameters:
